key: 04.01 DP control system - Power Supplies – DP/IBS UPS 1
title: 04.01 DP control system
name: Power Supplies – DP/IBS UPS 1
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Fail input normal power to DP/IBS UPS 1. Restore (LP 207 – 23/25)
2. Fail input emergency power to DP/IBS UPS 1. Do not restore. (ELP 205 – 31/33)
3. Fail input normal power to UPS 1. Restore after 30 minutes.
4. Fail DP UPS 1 output power, simulating UPS backup battery failure. Restore.
5. Fail the output of DC A power supply. Restore

verifications.key: 1. Alarm- Normal power failure UPS1. Maintains power on ELP feed.
verifications.title: 1. Alarm- Normal power failure UPS1. Maintains power on ELP feed.

verifications.key: 2. Alarm - Emergency power failure UPS1. Maintains power with LP feed.
verifications.title: 2. Alarm - Emergency power failure UPS1. Maintains power with LP feed.

verifications.key: 3. Power Failure UPS 1, UPS 1 on battery backup for 30 minutes. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 3. Power Failure UPS 1, UPS 1 on battery backup for 30 minutes. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 4. Power Failure UPS 1, Failure alarms: CC1, CyScan, OC1, Net Switch A, Monitor A, DP Logger and 24vdc distribution A. (DGPS 1, Gyro 1, Wind 1, VRU 1, OP 1) Loss of TCS CC1 and half of TCS Operator Stations
verifications.title: 4. Power Failure UPS 1, Failure alarms: CC1, CyScan, OC1, Net Switch A, Monitor A, DP Logger and 24vdc distribution A. (DGPS 1, Gyro 1, Wind 1, VRU 1, OP 1) Loss of TCS CC1 and half of TCS Operator Stations

verifications.key: 5. Failure of DGPS 1, Gyro 1, Wind 1, VRU 1, and OP1.
verifications.title: 5. Failure of DGPS 1, Gyro 1, Wind 1, VRU 1, and OP1.

verifications.key: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading
verifications.title: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading

verifications.title: 4. Power Failure UPS 2, Failure Alarms: CC3, OC2, Net Switch B, Monitor B, RadaScan and 24vdc distribution B. (DGPS 2, Gyro 2, Wind 2, VRU 2, OP 2). ) Loss of TCS CC3 and half of TCS Operator Stations.

key: 04.03 DP control system - DP Control Computer Net Connections
title: 04.03 DP control system
name: DP Control Computer Net Connections
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC1.Restore. (Port Aft Pedestal)
2. Disconnect Ethernet B Communications cable to CC1. Do not restore connection.
3. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC1 to simulate internal component failure. Restore both.
4. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC2. Restore. (Stbd Aft Pedestal)
5. Disconnect Ethernet B Communications cable to CC2. Do not restore connection.
6. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC2 to simulate internal component failure. Restore both.
7. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC3. Restore. (Stbd Aft Pedestal)
8. Disconnect Ethernet B Communications cable to CC3. Do not restore connection.
9. Disconnect Ethernet A Communications cable to CC3 to simulate internal component failure. Restore both.

key: 04.06 DP control system - DGPS 1 & 2
title: 04.06 DP control system
name: DGPS 1 & 2
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Select DGPS 1 as primary, DGPS 2 as secondary. Remove serial line SSB1 1/2 to DGPS 1. Restore
2. Select DGPS 1 as primary, disable secondary. Make a 20-meter box move.
3. Disconnect the power to DGPS1 by pulling the fuse in DPS-A.
4. Select DGPS 2 and DGPS 1 in weighing. Remove serial line SSB2 1/2 to DGPS 2.
5. Select DGPS 2 as primary, disable secondary. Make a 20-meter box move.
6. Disconnect the power to DGPS 2 by pulling the fuse in DPS-B.
7. Check that radio, Inmarsat and RADAR signals do not cause DGPS interference.
8. Select DGPS 1 as primary and DGPS 2 as secondary. Make a 360 degrees heading turn. Restore

verifications.key: 1. Lost Reference System DGPS 1 Primary. Automatic switch to secondary DGPS 2. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 1. Lost Reference System DGPS 1 Primary. Automatic switch to secondary DGPS 2. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 2. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.
verifications.title: 2. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.

verifications.key: 3. Lost of DGPS 1 alarm. Vessel continues with DGPS 2.
verifications.title: 3. Lost of DGPS 1 alarm. Vessel continues with DGPS 2.

verifications.key: 4. Lost Reference System DGPS 2. Automatic switch to DGPS 1. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 4. Lost Reference System DGPS 2. Automatic switch to DGPS 1. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 5. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.
verifications.title: 5. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.

verifications.key: 6. Lost of DGPS 2 alarm. Vessel continues with DGPS 1.
verifications.title: 6. Lost of DGPS 2 alarm. Vessel continues with DGPS 1.

verifications.key: 7. Normal operation no interference. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 7. Normal operation no interference. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 8. Both DGPS stay operating properly.
verifications.title: 8. Both DGPS stay operating properly.

verifications.key: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading
verifications.title: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading

key: 04.07 DP control system - CyScan
title: 04.07 DP control system
name: CyScan
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Select LADAR as primary, disable secondary. Make a 20-meter box move. Restore
2. Select LADAR as primary. Change the angle of the LADAR to decrease the brightness. Restore
3. Select LADAR as primary, DGPS 1 as secondary. Fail power to LADAR computer in use. Restore
4. Select LADAR as primary, DGPS 1 as secondary. Fail DP UPS1 power to the Cyscan PSU. Restore
5. Perform a follow target test with the target vessel. Keep speed below .03 knots.
6. Increase speed on target vessel to .06 knots and attempt to follow target.

verifications.key: 1. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.
verifications.title: 1. Vessel performs box move with little or no overshoot.

verifications.key: 2. Lost Cyscan Target, Automatic switch to secondary DGPS. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 2. Lost Cyscan Target, Automatic switch to secondary DGPS. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 3. Computer shuts down, Cyscan continues operating into the DP with no control until computer resumes.
verifications.title: 3. Computer shuts down, Cyscan continues operating into the DP with no control until computer resumes.

verifications.key: 4. Lost Cyscan Target. Automatic switch to secondary DGPS 1. Maintains station.
verifications.title: 4. Lost Cyscan Target. Automatic switch to secondary DGPS 1. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 5. Vessel responds by keeping in line with target vessel, DP operation.
verifications.title: 5. Vessel responds by keeping in line with target vessel, DP operation.

verifications.key: 6. As speed increases, CyScan signal is lost and follow target is stopped.
verifications.title: 6. As speed increases, CyScan signal is lost and follow target is stopped.

verifications.key: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading
verifications.title: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading

key: 04.08 DP control system - RadaScan
title: 04.08 DP control system
name: RadaScan
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Select RADAR Scan as primary. Make a 20-meter box move.
2. Select RADAR Scan as primary. Change the heading of the vessel 360 degrees.
3. Select RADAR Scan as primary. DGPS 1 as secondary. Fail DP UPS 2 (F2) to RadaScan. Restore (DP/IBS UPS 2)
4. Select RADAR Scan as primary, DGPS 1 as secondary. Fail power to Radascan computer in use. Restore (DP/IBS UPS 2).
5. Perform a follow target test with the target vessel. Keep speed below .03 knots.
6. Increase speed on target vessel to .06 knots and attempt to follow target.

verifications.key: 2. Loss of target information, due to blocking of target from stacks/ mast.

verifications.title: 3. Lost RadaScan Target, Automatic switch to DGPS. Maintains station.

verifications.key: 4. Computer shuts down, Radascan continues operating into the DP with no control until computer resumes.

verifications.key: 5. Vessel responds by keeping in line with target vessel, DP operation.
verifications.title: 5. Vessel responds by keeping in line with target vessel, DP operation.

verifications.key: 6. As speed increases, Radascan signal is lost and follow target is stopped.
verifications.title: 6. As speed increases, Radascan signal is lost and follow target is stopped.

verifications.title: Verify that maximum deviation is less than 5m absolute positioning and 2 degrees heading

key: 04.10 DP control system - Gyro Compass Redundancy
title: 04.10 DP control system
name: Gyro Compass Redundancy
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Remove serial line SSB1-5 to heading reference sensor GC 1. Restore.
2. Remove Ready Signal SSB1-23 to heading reference sensor GC 1. Restore.
3. Pull the fuse in DPS-A distribution for Gyro 1. Restore.
4. Remove serial line SSB2-5 to heading reference sensor GC 2. Restore.
5. Remove Ready Signal SSB2-23 to heading reference sensor GC 2. Restore.
6. Pull the fuse in DPS-B distribution for Gyro 2. Restore.
7. Remove serial line SSB1-11 and SSB2-11 to heading reference sensor GC 3. Restore.
8. Pull the fuse in DPS-C distribution for Gyro 3. Restore.
9. Change the angle of a GC 10 degrees to simulate deviation in heading. Restore.

key: 04.11 DP control system - Vertical Reference Unit Redundancy
title: 04.11 DP control system
name: Vertical Reference Unit Redundancy
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Select VRU 1. Remove serial line from SSB1 9/10 to primary VRU 1. Restore
2. Select VRU 2. Remove serial line from SSB2 9/10 to secondary VRU 2. Restore
3. Select VRU 3. Remove serial line from SSB1 & SSB2 15/16 to VRU 3. Restore
4. Remove the power to VRU 1 in DPS-A Distribution by pulling the fuse. Restore.
5. Remove the power to VRU 2 in DPS-B Distribution by pulling the fuse. Restore.
6. Remove the power to VRU 3 in DPS-C Distribution by pulling the fuse. Restore.
7. Select VRU 1 or 2. Detach VRU and gradually tilt fwd 25 degrees.

key: 04.13 DP control system - DP Operator Panel Redundancy
title: 04.13 DP control system
name: DP Operator Panel Redundancy
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Select OP1 in command. Remove 24V-DC line A to OP1 at port aft pedestal. Restore.
2. Select OP2 in command. Remove 24V-DC line B to OP2 at stbd aft pedestal. Restore.
3. Select OP1 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable A to OP1, Restore.
4. With OP1 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable B to OP1, Do not restore.
5. With OP1 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable A to OP1, Restore.
6. Select OP2 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable A to OP2, Restore.
7. With OP2 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable B to OP2, Do not restore.
8. With OP2 in command. Disconnect Ethernet cable A to OP2, Restore.

actions:

actions:

1. Set Joystick gains to high, using DP JS, put vessel into environment, thrust to port using maximum thrust hold for 1 minute.

actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power. Deselect all position reference sensors.

key: 04.18 DP control system - Maneuvering, Position, and Heading Control
title: 04.18 DP control system
name: Maneuvering, Position, and Heading Control
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Perform a box movement with two 90 degrees heading turns.
2. Set position speed to high and order a 200m position Fwd. Stop vessel at 1.0 knot with "present position" button.
3. Set position speed to high and order a 200m position to the Port. Stop vessel at 1.0 knot with "present position" button.
4. Set rotation speed to high and order a 90 degrees heading move stbd. Stop vessel using "present heading" at 45 degrees.
5. Activate the Consequence Analysis by either deselecting a thruster or turning vessel into the environment.
6. Set vessel on DP Endurance test for 8 hours. Observe alarms, print plot every hour.

verifications.key: 1. Perform a box movement with two 90 degrees heading turns.
verifications.title: 1. Perform a box movement with two 90 degrees heading turns.

verifications.key: 2. Thruster increases, vessel stopped by thrusters and position becomes stable fairly quickly. No thruster/ diesel deselect or thruster alarm.

actions:

name: Port Combi-drive, PZD
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Fail the LVS1 secondary 480VAC supply to the steering frequency controller. (+SCP-2S1)
2. Fail the LVS1 primary 480VAC supply to the steering frequency controller. (+SCP-1S1)
3. Fail the AC/DC converter for 24VDC supply to Control cabinet. Restore. (SCS-S2)
4. Fail the UPS 24 VDC to the cabinet. Observe results and restore. (+SCS-F15)
5. Fail the feedback from the PZD by loss of the encoder. (+SCS-X8.30)
6. Fail a steering motor by pushing the test switch on the control cabinet motor starter, simulating an electrical short. (+SCP-FM1)
7. Fail the braking system by simulation of overheating. (+BR-R1 +SCS-X8.1)

The VFD capacitors will be discharged and ready to start after one minute. Record time to restore power and distance off position.

4. Fail the stbd gen #4 day tank low-level alarms. Restore
5. Verify that the fuel is split correctly.
6. Simulate the loss of Port MVS by electrical short by E stops on DG1/2 engines. Restore
7. Simulate the loss of Stbd MVS by electrical short by E stops on DG3/4 engines. Restore

key: 10.01 Auxiliary Systems - Air Compressors
title: 10.01 Auxiliary Systems
name: Air Compressors
actions:
With the vessel is in auto DP, all thrusters are online, two DGs online, (one port DG1 or 2 and one stbd DG3 or 4) with MVS bus tie closed and LVS bus tie open and EGen in auto standby. All systems available and alarms clear. Offline generators are configured in auto standby in the event of failure to recover loss power.

1. Confirm auto start of lead starting air compressor by draining air receivers. Isolate Compressor (Cargo Area)
2. Further drain air receivers until lagging air compressor also auto starts. Isolate Compressor (Cargo Area)
3. Drain air receivers until low starting air pressure alarm results. Restore both Compressors.

verifications.key: 1. Lead air compressor starts and tries to restore air pressure.

verifications.key: 2. Lagging air compressor starts and tries to restore air pressure.

verifications.key: 3. Low starting air pressure alarm.

actions:
